Fajiran is a 23-year-old married woman. She and her husband, Bablu, have completed secondary education. Now she is a mother to her only son, who is too small to go to school. Her husband is a van puller and Fajiran looks after her animal husbandry. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children and provide them a better life in the near future. 

Fajiran has taken out a loan to purchase a cow for her animal husbandry so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream true. Now she lives in a semi-pakka house (walls of concrete, roof of straw and bamboo-made), but with the profit of her new business they hope to build a pakka house (made of bricks and cement) and improve the family’s financial condition in the future.

They are thankful to Belghoria Janakalyan Samity and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Probhati

texts.en:
Probhati is 43 years old and married to Binoy from the small village of Maynaguri. She and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names. Still then, her two sons have achieved the degrees of BA (Bachelor of Arts) and HS (Higher Secondary) smoothly.

Her husband has a decorator business, but his income is insufficient to run his family smoothly. Due to the great demand for this business for various kinds of ceremonies, he chose this for his profession but he has deficits in decorator items variety. Now Probhati is taking out a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase more decorator items, like chairs, tables, tablecloths, paper glasses, etc., to meet the local demand and increase their income. This will enable her to expand the business and improve her son’s education.

Probhati is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her existing decorator business.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima lives at north Khamarbari in a small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her two sons and her husband Anil. Both Purnima and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. One of their children is receiving education and the other is a mason. 

Purnima has a milk supply business, and it is admirable that she is able to do that along with maintaining her household work.  But nowadays, when the prices of essential goods are increasing day by day, it is impossible for her to run her family well with their small income. She wants to buy one more cow to expand her existing business.

When Purnima came to know about BJS and about microfinance, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to buy one more cow. She hopes it will help her to develop her business which will generate an extra income to meet the financial needs of her family and give better education to her son. She also hopes to set aside the extra profit to make a dairy farm of her own.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and expand her existing business of selling milk and dairy products in the market.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is 21 years old and her husband is 27 years old. They live in the village Khagrabari of Maynaguri with their two children. Amongst them one is in class III (grade 3) and the other one is still too small to go to school. Both Kalpana and her husband have completed their class X (grade 10) standard.
She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. He farms different kinds of vegetables and crops to sell them in the local market. 

Now Kalpana is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds and fertilizers of bitter melons for farming as an additional vegetable because it is a very profitable business in her area. Kalpana hopes that the cultivation of bitter melon will help her in growing her income and she can be able to overcome her family’s piteous condition.

Kalpana is overwhelmed with thanks to BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers of bitter melon for farming

loans.name: Pobitra

texts.en:
Pobitra is a 49-year-old married woman from the small village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband, Sunil, and two children (one son and one daughter). Both Pobitra and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their children are receiving education. Their son is pursuing his bachelor degree and their daughter is in class X (grade 10).

The main source of income for this family is their agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where usually rice is grown. Pobitra and her husband work hard and always have high quality rice which is sold to local retailers. She needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family, so she has applied for a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity to buy good quality paddy seeds and fertilizers. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members – especially her children – have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Girobala

texts.en:
Girobala is a 41-year-old married woman and her husband is 46 years old. Both of them are illiterate but can sign their names. She has two children and one of them is receiving education while  the other one works as an electrician. They live in a small town of Maynaguri region. 

Girobala's husband repairs cycle-vans and she runs a grocery shop but income from her business has not been good due to the limited variety of groceries, so their family is struggling. She is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) of INR 15,000 for purchasing new and different grocery items, hoping the sales will increase and provide greater profits. As she was unable to educate her son due to low income, she wants to provide higher education to her daughter which will be possible only by the business profit. 

Now she is grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding the loan for her business.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of grocery items to expand her own grocery business.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is a 32-year-old married woman from the small village of North Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband Bablu and two children (one son and one daughter).They are receiving education; her son is in class IX (Grade-9) and her daughter is in class X (Grade-10).Both Nilima and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Nilima is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer. The earnings of her husband are not sufficient to maintain their simple lifestyle and the expenses of the household.

Nilima chose BJS for this loan as she wants to purchase a cow and she hopes to earn a profit from this business as there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality and in the present market. She needs to start this business to give additional financial support to her family. She wants to build a sanitary latrine and give proper education to their children with the profit.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start a dairy product business.

loans.name: Rahab Njoki

texts.en:
Rahab lives in a small town a few kilometers from the capital city of Kenya - Nairobi. She is a salonist and operates a small salon, but one that is very helpful to the women around. Rahab works till late into the night as most of her customers are employed and the only time they are free is in the evening. There is electricity in her locality but it is very expensive for her to maintain, and it takes up a big portion of her profit. This leads to stagnation, retaining her at the same economic status for years.

Her alternative is solar power. By embracing solar power, she can cut down her expenses by using the solar power for lighting and phone charging, and only use electricity for the hair drier. She can also use the same solar lantern in her home after work while cooking and for her children to study.

In addition to the solar lantern, we also recommended that she buys an efficient cookstove that is more economical than what she was using to heat water for her clients. The traditional jiko would take up so much charcoal due to heat loss and could not be used in an enclosed place due to carbon emmisions. The new jiko would enable her save at least 50% of the charcoal previously used and reduce on carbon emmisions ensuring a healthier envirofit for her and her customers.

loans.use: to pay for a solar lamp and an energy saving cookstove.

loans.name: Aaliya

texts.en: Aaliya is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community, which she has been doing for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.40,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Elbina

texts.en:
Elbina is 46 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children.
 
Elbina is a house wife. The family earns their living from the wages of her husband, who is a carpenter. He is earning an amount of not less than PHP 9,000 each month from doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs. Elbina has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. As a member, she enjoyed the programs and services offered by the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 58 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children who are now adults.
 
Leonila earns a living from her sari-sari (general) store and from selling a variety of viand (food) from her stall. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail, and meats, dressed chicken, beef and spices for her viand vending business respectively.
 
Leonila has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell, and meats, dressed chicken, beef and spices for her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 49 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child.
 
Paulina has been engaged in a pig fattening business for five years, and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase an additional two piglets, two sacks of starter feed and three sacks of booster feed and vitamins for her pig raising business. Paulina has been a member of PMPC for almost two years already. In the future, Paulina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets, two sacks of starter feed and 3 sack of booster feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 52 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Edwina is engaged in a business buying and supplying sand and gravel, and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from this work. She has requested a loan to purchase an additional 10 cubic feet of sand and gravel to supply her clients in her municipality. 

Edwina has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Edwina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 10 cubic feet of sand and gravel.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 38 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child. 

Arnel earns a living from manufacturing fishing hook floaters of export quality, and earns not less than PHP 20,000 from this business activity. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional thin rods, floaters, paint and gloss for his business. 

Arnel has been a member of PMPC almost two years. In the future, Arnel hopes to expand his market not only in Asia but also to Europe and other continents.

loans.use: to purchase additional thin rods, floaters, paint and gloss for his business manufacturing fishing hook floaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, soap, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Karram Group

texts.en:
Karram is a five-member group. All the members of the group are poor ladies from Taiz, Yemen. Together they applied for a 200,000 YER loan from AMB.

Horia is a 40-year-old married woman who has some children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Taiz. Her house is very old and in a miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she needs more money in order to complete the renovation. She asked for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to use for renovating her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fertilizer and agriculture seeds for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bottled water, butter, soap and cigarettes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts and clothing material to resell.

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.en:
Mahsudjon is 18 years old. He is a student in his first year. Mahsudjon studies at the Tajikistan State University of Commerce. He is one of the best students. He likes subjects such as history and geography. 

Mahsudjon is not married and he lives with his parents. Mahsudjon is asking for a loan to pay for tuition at the university because his parents do not have the opportunity to pay for his tuition. This is the first loan from IMON and KIVA. He thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Alhan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Alhan and is comprised of four women. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER.

Safia lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is 39 years old, married and has children. For the last four years, Safia has worked selling different clothes. She is a professional in this field. She started her business with a small amount of capital. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy dresses, pants, shirts and other clothes. Her extra income from the loan will improve her living standards. Her dream is to expand her business and open a clothing resale store.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, shirts and other clothes for her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 56-year old client who has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX to buy chicks that he will raise and sell. 

He is married with 6 children and comes from a village in Nyabikuuku, Nyakagyeme Rukungiri district. 

His major source of income is agriculture and he grows bananas and raises chicks. He earns additional income from teaching. 

His major challenge has been limited working capital and he hopes that with this loan, he will improve his agriculture activities into commercial farming. 
He hopes to increase his size of land for more agriculture expansion.

loans.use: to buy young chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rwakigaju Tukore2 Group

texts.en:
Lillian is one of the leaders of the group Rwakigaju Tukore2, a group with a lot of history and excellent payment behavior. This group is made up of five members who will invest in agricultural activities. She is a very hardworking and independent woman. She is 54 years old, married, and has four children who are all older and already have their own families. The whole family is dedicated to the raising and development of livestock in addition to the cultivation of fruits and vegetables.

Both her and her group members engage in agricultural activities. This new investment will be working capital for the purchase of animals as well as their food and supplies for planting and crop care. This group has accomplished many things thanks to their commitment to paying very well, and among these accomplishments are contributing to her family expenses, helping her grandchildren with their studies, and motivating other women in her community to work together as a group and efficiently administer financial resources. Lillian is hard working and will use the money to buy goats that she will rear and earn income to pay for her grandchildren's school dues.

loans.use: to buy baby goats.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a caring mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). She is a 26-year-old housewife who is illiterate.  She lives in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her children and her husband Aliar who is 30 years old and uneducated.  They have a kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made). Hasina's husband is a fish vender in the local market and his income is the only source of income for the family. Hasina always tries to educate her children. But money is the main hindrance in her way. She cannot give her children private tuition and the necessary educational articles, since her husband's income is very low
.
One of her sons, Sahibul, is a meritorious student.  He reads in grade 7. He is very serious about his studies and without the help of any private tutor, he stands first in every class.  He wants to be an I.P.S. officer in the future. Thus, Hasina is determined to give support to her son so that he does not face any difficulty in receiving an education.

Hasina has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay her son's tuition fees and school fees and to purchase books, notebooks, pens, pencils, uniform etc. Hasina hopes that this loan will be a great help for her son to go forward to fulfill his dream. Hasina and her son are very pleased and thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase educational supplies and to pay tuition and private coaching fees for her son

loans.name: Sitarani

texts.en:
Sitarani, a 42-year-old housewife, is from the remote village of Khalaigram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri . She is married to Binoy who is 42 years old.  Both husband and wife are uneducated and can only sign their names. They are blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter).  They are all students in grade 10, grade 9 and grade 8, respectively. Sitarani's husband is associated with cultivation on their own piece of land, which does not provide them sufficient income to run the family well.

Sitarani's youngest son, Shubhendu, who is in grade 8, is a smart and brilliant boy and stands first in class every year.  Sitarani always worries about making enough money and saving some of it for her children's education. Every year, she faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year for the additional expenditures that are needed to cover school fees, uniform and books.

Thus, Sitarani has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner’s BJS to pay for her son's tuition fees and other school expenses and to purchase necessary articles like books, pens, pencils, geometry box, uniform etc.  With this loan, she can accommodate all these expenses. She aims to see her son in the best university.

In this picture are Sitarani and her son Shubhendu, who will benefit from the loan. Both of them are grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this educational loan.

loans.use: To purchase educational supplies and pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar, age 52, is a married woman and the mother of six children. She has a business selling blankets to the people of her community. She purchases a variety of blankets from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns sufficient income to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs. 60,000. This will help her to purchase a variety of blankets in various colors and designs to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of blankets in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy home construction materials such as iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, and cement.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents. Zaur’s family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons), now living in Bala Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region. 

Zaur is a master at making iron doors and windows frames. After, he sells those products and earns monthly income. Now, he wants to buy a new apparatus, which is necessary in his business. Therefore Zaur has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Zaur says great thanks to Kiva organization for its help. In the future he wants to open his own factory and in his personal life he wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus for his business making iron doors and window frames.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida lives in the remote village of Shalbari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a housewife. She is 27 years old and attended school up to grade 7. Her husband Habibur is a 30-year-old farmer who has an education up to grade 7. They are blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  All three children are school going.  They are in grade 5, grade 3 and grade 2.

Rashida's husband is associated with agribusiness. His income is hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of her children.  She desires that her children do not face any obstacle in receiving their education.

Rashida's daughter Sahanara is now in grade 5.  She is a girl of strong determination and very meritorious.  If she could get private tuition, she could do much better in her final exam.  She wants to be a doctor in the future.

Rashida learned about BJS (Kiva's partner) and applied for a loan from BJS for her daughter's uninterrupted education. With the loan, she will pay the private tuition fees and school fees and purchase necessary articles like books, notebooks, pens, geometry box, uniforms etc. for educational purposes for her daughter.

Rashida and her daughter are very much grateful to the lenders for this loan.

loans.use: To pay school fees and tuition fees and buy school supplies for her daughter

loans.name: Al-Malak Group

texts.en:
This is a group with initiative, values and good principles on how to conduct business nowadays. The group is called "Al-Malak" and consists of five women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They are each interested in developing their businesses. They requested a loan of 420,000 YER.

Bushra is the group leader. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children. Her business is embroidery: ladies' clothes, bags and children's clothes. This has been her sole source of income for over three years. She began this activity as a result of the lack of a clothing market in her neighborhood. With the income from her business, she could improve her home and enjoy more comfort. At the present time, her business doesn't get her more profits due to the bad situation in Yemen. She applied for a loan from AMB to acquire articles for embroidery such as needles and thread, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her business income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open manual labor stores.

loans.use: to acquire articles for embroidery such as needles and thread for her business.

loans.name: Ban Banh Tl - D12 Group

texts.en:
Huong is a 30-year-old Thai woman and lives in a family of 8 which include her in-laws, husband, two siblings and two children. 

Her family relies on agricultural activities such as cultivating rice, vegetables, and fruit and raising cattle, chickens and fish. 

In order to cover tuition fees for her two school-aged children, a 4th and 1st grader, Huong's husband works for a local construction company. Despite all her efforts, her school of fish died this winter.  This incident has brought even more difficulties to her family. 

Huong hopes that her children will escape the vicious circle of poverty by sending them to school. Regardless of the bad situation now, Huong doesn't stop trying.  She will use this loan to buy pig and fish food.

In the picture, Huong is second from the left.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fish

loans.name: Ruma

texts.en:
Ruma is 35 years old and married to Subhash. Her family lives in a village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her only daughter, Laboni. Ruma has read up to grade 9 while her husband received his bachelor's degree. Ruma looks after her family. Her husband earns a living through farming potatoes and raising animals. Her husband, having been in this business for many years, is unable to earn sufficient money to meet her family’s needs, so Ruma is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees for her schooling without any monetary disturbances.

She hopes to keep her daughter in school as a regular candidate, which will be possible only with this loan. Otherwise, Ruma would have to stop her daughter’s education. As Laboni is a meritorious student and has a tremendous liking for biology, she dreams of being a doctor in the future. For this reason, Ruma is trying her best to keep it up and give her proper support as per her requirements to go through her studies.

Ruma and Laboni (standing beside Ruma in the photograph) thank Kiva and BJS for funding the loan.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees and school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Ban Noong Tl - D11 Group

texts.en:
Danh is a 37-year-old single mother living in a family of 6 which includes three daughters, a son-in-law and her nephew. Her husband passed away 7 years ago. 

Her household is no longer considered a poor household and therefore doesn't receive as much support as they once did.  However, the family still has many economic and social difficulties. The three daughters dropped out of school to support their mother (two of them completed 9th grade and another completed 11th grade).  Family members cultivate rice and work for the local construction company. The recent rice harvest was very bad due to insect damage. To cover living expenses, she also breeds swans, chickens, and grows grain and vegetables. 

Danh wants to buy pigs to expand her business. She hopes that through ACE's loan and training, she can increase her income and manage her business better.  She wants to rebuild her thatched cottage and gradually escape from poverty.

In the picture, Danh is wearing a black coat.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 47 years old, and is married with two children. His son studies in his second course of college, and the daughter goes to eleventh class.

Hamlet’s wife is a housewife and helps Hamlet with his business. His family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city for 21 years now, and now they are living in Araz Dilagarda village of Füzuli region. 

Hamlet has cows. He sells their milk and milk products (yoghurt, cheese etc) which are made by Hamlet and his wife. Now, Hamlet wants to repair the roof of the cows' stall. Therefore he needs a loan of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). It's his second loan. Hamlet is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the cows' stall.

loans.name: Ban Nguu Tl - D15 Group

texts.en:
Dung is a  27-year-old woman who lives with her husband, in-laws and her two children. One child is in 1st grade and the other is16 months old. 

To earn more money to better support her family, Dung works as a trader in Lao and Vietnam. Her family's main income is from farming and raising cattle, pigs and poultry. 

This is Dung's first loan in Anh Chi Em Program and she wants to use a portion of the loan to buy pigs to increase production. She hopes that by improving her earnings, she can rebuild the house and send her children to college.

In the picture, Dung is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maintenance for the food cart and ingredients for breakfasts

loans.name: Muong Phang Group

texts.en:
Suoi, 27 years old, is the team leader of Muong Phang Group, which consists of 11 ladies. She  lives with her husband and 2 small children (ages 4 and 3 months old).

Her family is in a difficult situation because agriculture is the only source of income.  The last harvest was bad and the pigs became diseased. For that reason, Suoi wants  a loan from ACE to overcome her current problems and buy more pigs and chickens. 

She hopes that through the loan and the knowledge gained from ACE training lessons, she can improve her income and have the ability to send the children to university.

In the picture, Suoi is standing first on the right.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ahlied Yusmid

texts.es:
Ella es Ahlied Yusmid es  madre cabeza de familia, tiene tres hermosos hijos Briggyd Ximena de 21 años, Diana carolina de 15 años, Michel Valeria de 10 años; hace un año termino el bachillerato,  pues fue madre adolescente a los 17 años y tuvo  que aplazar todos los proyectos, Por que cuando se tienen  hijos hay que darle prioridad a las necesidades y si hay para ellos no hay para otros.
Hoy en día tiene 38 años y pensó que nunca es tarde para aprender, se entero de los programas académicos y le llamo la atención  el curso técnico como auxiliar judicial, pues siempre tuvo la ilusión de estudiar derecho y le parece una gran oportunidad  la cual quiere aprovechar.
texts.en:
This is Ahlied Yusmid. She is a mother and head of her family. She has three beautiful children - Briggyd Ximena, 21 years old, Diana Carolina, 15 years old, and Michel Valeria, 10 years old. Ahlied just finished high school as she became a mother at 17 years old and had to postpone her education. When you have children, they are your priority. You have to give them what they need and everything in for them and not for anyone else.

Ahlied is now 38 years old and believes it is never to late to learn. She learned about the academic programmes available and is interested in working as a legal assistant. Ahlied always wanted to study law and this seems like a great opportunity, of which to take advantage.

loans.use: to pay matriculation fees for one semester.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una señora soltera de 38 años de edad, actualmente vive con sus tres hijos en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora, que se esmera por salir adelante con su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de jaspeados que son utilizados en la ropa típica, esta actividad la eligió porque es bastante rentable y productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias. Por lo que ahora lleva ocho años realizando esta labora que le ayuda a sufragar los gastos de su familia.
Ella ha observado que cada vez existe más demanda en este producto, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,500.00 para la compra de hilo y tinta que servirá para la elaboración de este producto artesanal.
Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia a través de la labor que realiza.
texts.en:
Marta is 38 years old and single. She lives with her three children in the Sololá department.

Marta is a hard-working woman who takes great pains in order to prosper with her family. She currently makes a living producing woven products, which are used to make typical clothes. Marta chose this work as it is quite profitable and productive in terms of income and profits. Marta has now been doing this work for eight years, helping her to cover family expenses.

Marta has noticed that demand for her products is increasing and so she is applying for a loan of 2500 Qetzal in order to buy threads and dyes to make this artisan good.

Marta's dream is to improve her family's living conditions through her work.

loans.use: to buy threads and dyes for making woven goods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Es  una joven llamada María, ella es muy bella y trabajadora, lo hace para cumplir muchos sueños y metas que tenía propuestas. Una de ellos era estudiar Estética en la mejor escuela que ella conocía, esta academia tenía por nombre CAMPO ALTO.
Un día María estaba trabajando como acostumbraba, mientras hacia las labores apareció una joven,  pero se le notaba algo agotada ya triste, necesitaba una persona que le pudiera ayudar a la tener mejor ánimo, ayudarla a sentirse mejor físicamente, a si que esa fue la motivación que tuvo maría para empezar a estudiar cosmetología, a si que maría se lleno de energía para empezar a estudiar, par que con mucho  esfuerzo ella logre ayudar a muchas personas. 
Ella muy contenta fue a la academia y se presentó, mientras iba pensando en ayudar a las personas que lo necesiten. Después de unos días la joven se enteró que uno de los grandes sueños por fin se cumplió, entro a campo alto y con mucho esfuerzo ahora solo queda luchar por un nuevo objetivo.

El  nuevo sueño es  crear un lugar, donde las personas   se puedan descansar,  relajándose de varias formas y mejorando la apariencia personal, para que la gente siga siendo la más hermosa que existiera.
Ahora solo le queda a  María que pueda estudiar y para ello necesita el convenio con kiva, para que realice el sueño de poder ayudar a muchas personas que lo necesiten, para que la gente que visite su spa quiera entrar y se quieran quedar más tiempo.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young person called María. She is very beautiful and hardworking. The loan is to help her complete many of the dreams and goals that she has. One of them is to study Aesthetics at the best school that she knows, which is called Campo Alto.
One day, María was working as usual, and, while she was doing her work, a young person appeared. But, she seemed somewhat tired and sad and needed someone who could help her to be in a better mood and to help her feel better physically. This was what motivated María to study cosmetics and María is full of energy to start her studies so that she can help many people. 
She was very happy to go to the academy and to be presented, and meanwhile, she was thinking about helping people who need it. After some days, she achieved one of her biggest dreams, and was enrolled at Campo Alto and now she has a new goal to work for.
Her new dream is to create a place where people can rest, where they can relax in various ways and improve their personal appearance so that they can continue to be the most beautiful people that there are.
Now, all that María needs is to study, and for that she needs the agreement with Kiva in order to realize her dream of being able to help the people who need it so that the people who visit her spa want to go in and want to stay longer.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Briyith Jhanjaira

texts.es: a Señorita Briyith Jhanjaira está Interesada En El técnico auxiliar en atención ala primera infancia. Pues a ella le interesa  bastante el tema,  ya que sabe y le gusta desenvolverse muy bien con los niños, el técnico para ella seria de gran utilidad pues a mediano plazo ella piensa montar la propia empresa  y poder trabajar para pagarse la carrera  profesional, ya que ella tiene muchas metas a largo plazo , esta muy interesa en alcanzar las metas, pues ella no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos para lograr este propósito a mediano y largo plazo, ya que por eso se ve interesada en tener el descuento con kiva, ella cuenta con las capacidades de poder culminar el técnico en las instalaciones pues ya que a tenido buenas referencias de el  y quiere lograr el propósito más grande que tiene.
texts.en: Briyith Jhanjaira is interested in being a technical assistant in early childhood care. She is quite interested in the topic as she is good with children. The course would be of great help to her as her medium-term plan is to open her own business and be able to pay for her professional degree. She has many long-term goals and very much wants to achieve those goals. However, she doesn't have many economic resources with which to achieve these medium- and long-term goals. For this reason, she is interested in securing a loan from Kiva. She has the capacity to complete the course and she has good references and wants to achieve her larger goals.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Ximena Andrea

texts.es:
La Señorita Ximena Andrea es Una Persona con muchas cualidades,  y  habilidades que desarrolla en el diario vivir.
Tiene un gran anhelo que es poder  estudiar la carrera de investigación judicial,  ya que se siente capacitada para  responder con los compromisos educativos, comprometiéndose  a ser una estudiante con un nivel académico alto.
Desde siempre ella ha sido una señorita muy responsable y sobresaliente en cuanto al nivel académico, ya que los intereses siempre han sido enfocados hacia las leyes constituciones, investigaciones y demás trabajos relacionados frente a la carrera de investigación judicial que comenzara. 
Ella por ser una estudiante  muy sobresaliente merece que en este momento de la vida le otorguen este subsidio de kiva,  ya que ella se comprometerá a estudiar y sacar adelante la carrera con  buenos resultados, sumándole  a esto las ganas y el empeño que desde ya tiene por ser una profesional, ya que esto es un logro para la vida y el desarrollo personal. 
Ella siempre a pensando en  que las metas y los logros  propuestos, ella sabe que siempre se podrán cumplir si se tiene el interés, la actitud y sobre todo las ganas de salir adelante para poderse superar.
Algo que la caracteriza es la humildad porque el pensamiento siempre se ha basado en que las cosas  se obtienen paso a paso  con esfuerzo y dedicación y que todo lleva el proceso hasta conseguir el objetivo propuesto. Teniendo muy claro la misión para el futuro.
texts.en:
Ximena Andrea is a person with many qualities and skills that she develops in her daily life.
She has a great desire to be able to study for a degree in criminal investigation as she feels able to meet the educational commitments and to be a student who achieves at a high academic level. 
She has always been a very responsible young woman and academically outstanding. Her interest has always been focused on constitutional law and investigation and other work related to the criminal investigation career that she will pursue. 
Because she is an outstanding student, she deserves to be awarded this loan from Kiva at this time in her life. She promises to study and get good grades in her course, and adds to this the great desire that she already has to be a professional as this is a goal for life and her professional development. 
She has always thought about these goals and achievements and knows that she can achieve them if she has the interest, the attitude, and, above all, the desire to be successful and overcome difficulties. 
One thing that characterizes her is humility and her thought has always been to take things step by step, with hardwork and dedication, and that everything leads towards her objective. Her mission for the future is very clear.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita ella es casada , tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta y crianza de animales como pollos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia a la vez se dedica conjuntamente con su esposo a la carpinteria,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el  crédito para la compra de pollos para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, panificadora, servicio de mudanza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Moyopata de San Sebastian. This bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.
One member, Margarita, is married, is 36 years old, and has 2 children. This member works selling and raising animals such as chickens. The member has been doing this for some time and has done well thanks to effort that she puts into her business every day. She raises small animals in order to sell them later to her customers. At the same time, she works with her husband as a carpenter and this is how she is raising her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy chickens for her business. 
The other members work in businesses selling chicha (a corn-based drink), doing carpentry, selling groceries, raising small animals, baking, and running a moving service.
The member is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way and promises to make the payments according to the agreement.

loans.use: to buy chickens for their business.

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es: La señora María vive en el municipio de Colomi de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos pequeños, económicamente es independiente percibe ingresos de la actividad agrícola, siembra en su terreno propio de 2 Has, en el cual produce papa y haba, además se dedica a la venta en una tienda de Barrio en su domicilio, actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar productos para su tienda y poder ofrecer más variedad ya que es la única tienda por el sector donde vive y diversificando su oferta podrá mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, para ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María lives in the town of Colomi and is 35 years old. She is a single mother and has 2 small children. She is economically independent and gets income from farming. She grows on her own 2 hectares of land where she produces potatoes and beans. She also sells goods in a neighborhood store that she runs from her home. She is currently requesting a loan to buy products for her store so that she can offer greater variety. It is the only store in the area where she lives and diversifying her stock would improve her store and increase her sales so that she can offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Fayri Mariola

texts.es:
Fayri Mariola es una joven estudiante de Medicina, ella esta solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Fayri, tengo 20 años de edad,  soy la 4ta de 5 hermanos, nacida y criada en Mao, Valverde. En la actualidad estoy establecida en la Residencia Madre Elísea (Hnas. Carmelitas) en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, ya que mi madre es minusválida, quien se hizo cargo de mí fueron las religiosas de este albergue.
Actualmente estudiante cursante del 8vo semestre de Medicina en la UASD. A muy temprana edad me decidí a introducirme en el mundo de las Ciencias De La Salud  con la esperanza de no solo ser una gran profesional y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a mi familia sino también algún día yo misma poder devolverle la movilidad de ambas piernas a  mi madre que tanta fuerza y amor me ha dado… cumplir su sueño y el mío.
Por lo que en enero del 2010 me matricule en la UASD en la carrera de medicina. Hoy adoro la Anatomía, incluso quisiera ser cirujana y, a pesar de tantos altos y bajos en mi “turbulenta universidad”, amo mi carrera.
Mi familia ya no puede costearme siquiera la humilde cuota del lugar donde resido y porque no quiero abandonar mis estudios busque opciones y encontré  a FUNDAPEC y al programa KIVA.
Si Dios me lo permite, estoy a 1 año de finalizar el pensum de mi carrera y entrar al pre-internado, de no recibir el préstamo me vería en la obligación de detener mis estudios indefinidamente, marcharme a casa y empezar  de cero. Sueño con poder ayudar a mi mama, verla caminar de nuevo, a mi hermanito, que el al igual que yo pueda dedicarse a lo que ame con un poco menos de dificultades. 
Quiero ser de las mejores en lo que haga, ser consuelo, hacer mi especialidad  y trabajar en mi país ayudando a mi gente,  sé que con la ayuda de Dios puedo hacerlo.
texts.en:
Fayri Mariola is a young medical student and is asking for a loan to pay for her schooling expenses.  This is her story:  My name is Fayri.  I’m 20 years old and I’m the 4th of 5 siblings, born and raised in Mao, Valverde.  I currently live in the Madre Elisea Residence (Hnas. Carmelitas) in Santo Domingo, because my mother is disabled, and the religious people in this shelter took care of me.

I’m in my 8th semester of medical school at UASD.  I decided to go into the world of health sciences at an early age in the hopes of becoming not only a great professional and providing a better quality of life for my family, but also to someday restore movement to both of my mother’s legs.  She has given me so much strength and love… and I want to achieve her dream and mine.

In January 2010, I entered UASD as a medical student.  Today I love anatomy and I would also like to become a surgeon, even though I’ve had ups and downs at university, I love my career choice.

My family can’t even give me the small fee for the place where I live and I don’t want to give up my studies, and was looking for options.  I found FUNDAPEC and Kiva.

God willing, I am one year from finishing my curriculum and becoming an intern.  If I don’t get the loan I will have no choice but to postpone my education indefinitely, return home, and start over.  My dream is to be able to help my mother, to see her walk again, and help my younger brother meet his career goals with fewer difficulties.

I want to be one of the best, be comfortable, work in my specialty, and work in my country helping my people.  I know that I can do this with God’s help.

loans.use: to pay for medical school.

loans.name: Luceros De Lucma Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LUCEROS DE LUCMA, el banco está ubicado en el sector de Lucma, distrito de Vilcambamba,provincia de la Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Aleja tiene 48 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hjos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende dulces, chupetines, galletas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de eta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de galletas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de alimentos, restaurante, cultivo de café, venta de bebidas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the LUCEROS DE LUCMA communal bank, located in the tie Lucma area of the Vilcambamba district, Convención province, and Dusco department.

Aleja is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a snack business and sells candy, suckers, cookies, and other things, and has been doing this for some time.  Things are going well for her because of the effort she puts in.  She is a responsible and hardworking lady and gets her family ahead in this way.

She is asking for a loan to buy cookies and other things.

The other members are farmers, sell food, have restaurants, raise coffee, and sell beverages.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying her debts.

loans.use: to buy cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts and supplies.

loans.name: Katia Diana

texts.es:
La socia Katia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales y tambien tiene una pequeña tienda de multisevicios,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.


La señora Katia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Katia continues to raise animals and has small service store and has had this business for several years.  Things are going well for her and she works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her animals.  She is asking for a loan to buy Guinea pigs and chickens.

Katia is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Milton Lorenzo

texts.es:
Milton Lorenzo tiene 38 años de edad  estado civil unión libre vive con su hermana, esposa y sus dos hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la ventanilla Victoria que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantana, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Milton Lorenzo se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos y para dar mantenimiento especifico a sus siembras.

Vende sus productos en Ventanas.  El sueño es tener casa propia. El desafío al que se enfrenta es el mal tiempo y las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
38-year old Milton Lorenzo is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his sister, wife, and his two children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Victoria communal bank located in the neighbourhood of Pantano in the canton of Ventanas. The members work in agriculture and animal husbandry. Milton is a farmer growing corn and rice. He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his fields. He sells the crops in Ventanas.

Milton's dream is to have a house of his own. The challenges he faces are bad weather and crop disease. In his free time Milton enjoys being with his family and playing sports.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his corn crop

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en:
Nitu, the mother of two daughters, lives in Dhupguri with her husband, Sushanta. Her daughter Twinkle reads in class VI (grade 6) in a village school, and the elder sister is in class IX (grade 9). Nitu is a graduate and does service for a private concern, while her husband has a car business, renting cars to the people visiting Jalpaiguri’s delightful places. Both of them are hardworking and ambitious for their children. 

Their elder daughter is a moderate student going through her studies not smoothly, but Twinkle, their younger daughter, is studious as well as meritorious. She stood first in her class and has an extraordinary intellect to grasp any subject easily. All the teachers in her school are very much proud of her.

Nitu and her husband give support to their daughter, yet they cannot fulfill all the requirements needed for her education. Nitu needs some capital to give support to her daughter, so she is taking out a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy books of different subjects, guide books, sample papers which will increase her educational standard, and other necessary educational materials for her education. Twinkle aims to be a doctor in the future.

Nitu and her daughter Twinkle are highly obliged to Kiva and BJS, because it would not be possible for Nitu to inspire her daughter without their help.

loans.use: To purchase necessary educational materials for her daughter’s schooling.

loans.name: Diana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Diana del Pilar tiene 27 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con sus  hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Victoria que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Diana del Pilar se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra y para arrendar  terrenos.

Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas en el Comercial Franco. Su sueño es mejorar su cultivo y la producción para tener una mejor calidad de  vida y comprar un carro. El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza.  En su tiempo libre la gusta pasar con la familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
27-year old Diana del Pilar lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province. She is a member of the Victoria communal bank located in the Pantano neighbourhood which is part of Ventanas. The members work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Diana del Pilar grows corn and rice. She is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops and to lease land. She will make her purchases in Ventanas at the Franco store. Her dream is to improve her fields and production so she can have a better standard of living. She also wants to buy a car.

The biggest challenge Diana has to overcome is climate-related problems. In her free time she enjoys being with her family and playing sports.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Fernanda Leonor

texts.es:
Fernanda Leonor tiene 21 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con el esposo y sus 2 hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Victoria que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Fernanda Leonor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las compras lo realizan en comercial Donoso. Solicita el crédito  para la compra de insumos como los abonos, ureas, fertilizantes  que es un apoyo económico. Su sueño es mejorar la economía de la  familia. Los desafíos que se  enfrentan  dificultades económicas. 
Le gusta viajar los fines de semana con la familia.
texts.en:
Fernanda Leonor, 21, is in a civil union and lives with her husband and their two children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the Victoria communal bank in Recinto Pantano, part of the Ventanas canton. She works in farming and cattle.

Fernanda Leonor makes a living as a farmer, planting corn and rice. She makes her purchases at the Donoso store. She is requesting a loan, which provides economic support, to buy supplies such as manure, urea, and fertilizer. Her dream is to improve her family's economy. They face economy difficulties.

On the weekends, she likes to travel with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Narciso Antonio

texts.es:
Narciso Antonio tiene 48 años de vive con su madre y sus hijos en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de la ventanilla Victoria que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantana, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Narciso Antonio se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno para la siembra y comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes.  Las compras realizan en el  Cantón Ventanas en el  Comercial  García. Su sueño es comprar un carro.
El desafío que enfrenta es  el trabajo contra la maleza. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Narciso Antonio is 48 years old. He lives with his mother and his children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. He is a member of the Victoria credit group, located in the Pantana community, belonging to the Ventanas canton. It is dedicated to agricultural and livestock work. 

Narciso Antonio works growing corn and rice. He is asking for the loan to rent land to plant and to buy insecticide, urea, liquid weed killer, and fertilizer. He makes his purchases in the Ventanas canton at the García store. His dream is to buy a car. The challenge he faces is working against the weeds. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fertilizer.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.en:
Guljan and her husband live in Dhupguri with their two children. Though Guljan and her husband both are illiterate, only having the ability to sign their names, one of their children is studying in class VII (grade 7). As they are uneducated, their main intention in life is to raise her younger son, Murshid, with a stable education that may help him in future employment.

Both Guljan and her husband are working all day long on their own farmland, cultivating different kinds of vegetables to sell in the market, but they are unable to cover the family’s expenses. Their elder son is also helping them financially by doing mason work. Still, Murshid has to face certain problems in his school. Even sometimes, he is deprived of his textbooks, school uniforms, fees, etc. 

For this reason Guljan is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to solve all these problems Murshid is facing in his school.

Guljan’s and Murshid’s (as in the picture) earnest thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their kind support in funding them.

loans.use: to pay all the educational fees and tuition fees, and to buy books and uniforms for her son’s schooling.

loans.name: Jeanpier Alexander

texts.es: Jeanpier  de 20 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante técnico de administración bancaria, con la ayuda de sus padres, Jeanpier ha sabido salir adelante, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Jeanpier tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen técnico en administración bancaria. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Jeanpier se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  Kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Jeanpier is a 20-year old single man with no children. He is a nice student of Banking Administration who has been able to get ahead supported by his parents. He studies a lot to reach his goals in life. Jeanpier's goal is to graduate successfully to become a good professional in banking administration. 

He plans to use the loan to cover tuition and to buy the study materials he needs. Jeanpier is very grateful for the support provided and says goodbye wishing to reach his goal and thanking Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to cover tuition and to buy study materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stone, sand, gravel, zinc and iron, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Noemi Maria

texts.es:
Noemi María  tiene 20 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con el esposo y su hijo en el Cantón  Mocache Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de la ventanilla Victoria que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Noemi María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de arroz, maíz y lo necesario en la agricultura como la semilla y el abono.

Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas en el Comercial Franco. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos que se enfrenta es presencia de mucha lluvia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear en el pueblo y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Noemi María is 20 years old and lives with her common-law husband and son in the canton of Mocache in Los Ríos Province. She is a member of the Victoria communal bank located in the Pantano neighbourhood which is part of Ventanas. The members work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Noemi María grows rice and corn. She is seeking a loan so she can sow rice and plant corn, and buy other necessities such as manure. She will make her purchases in the town of Ventanas at the Franco store. Her dream is to improve her living conditions.

The challenge that Noemi María has to overcome is the over-abundance of rain. In her free time she likes to walk around in the town and watch television.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a housewife of Dhupguri living with her three children. All of them are students of different classes. Basanti herself is illiterate and can only sign her name, so each of her children needs too much assistance for their school studies, as well as for class tests.

Basanti’s husband is a farmer and spends most of his time in farming and raising animals on his own farmland. He has no time to look after his family and children because he is struggling over income, due to their poor financial condition. Basanti is unable to manage the family’s daily needs and bear the educational expenses of her children, due to the increased price of essential commodities nowadays. 

For this reason, she decided to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to bear the educational expenses of her elder daughter, Sushama, reading in class VII (grade 7). Basanti has a great ambition towards her elder daughter, that she will be in a good position with a higher education in upcoming days; Sushama will take the responsibility for her family in the future by making herself well-established. This loan will enable Basanti to give a bright future to her daughter Sushama and to fulfill her dream.

Basanti and her daughter Sushama are very happy after getting the loan and are thanking BJS and Kiva heartily.

loans.use: to cover the educational expenses of her daughter.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 25 años de edad estado civil unión libre  vive con su esposo e hija de 4 años  en el Cantón Mocache Provincia  Los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la ventanilla Victoria que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

María Esther se dedica a la siembra de maíz y crianza de gallinas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos y fertilizantes.

Las compras  realiza en el Comercial Montenegro en Ventanas.  Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos y comprarse una finca. El desafío que enfrenta es las malezas. En su tiempo libre le gusta visitar a los familiares.
texts.en:
María Esther is 25 years old. She is in a common law marriage and lives with her husband and 4 year old daughter in the Mocache canton, Los Ríos province. She is a member of the Victoria credit group, located in the community of Pantano, in the Ventanas canton. It is dedicated to agricultural and livestock work.  

María Esther works growing corn and raising chickens. She is asking for this loan to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer. She makes her purchases in the Montenegro store in Ventanas. Her dream is to improve the crop yields and to buy a farm. The challenge she faces is weeds. In her free time, she likes to visit family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es:
Mario de 36 años de edad,  estudio hasta 1 grado, es acompañado su pareja se decía a la agricultura, han procreado  3 hijos de los cuales los 3 estudian, con él vive su mamá. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería desde hace 15 años, lo aprendió por su padre, su negocio queda a 30 minutos él viaja a pie.

El cliente utilizara el préstamo, para sacar su cosecha, ya que le falta desgranar y almacena el grano.

Desea que su cosecha sea abundante para consumo de  su familia y para la venta, de estos ingresos espera usarlos para arreglar su cocina.
texts.en:
Mario is 36 years old and has a first grade education.  He is married and is a farmer.  They have three children and all attend school.  His mother lives with them.

He has been a farmer and mason for 15 years and learned this from his father.  His farm is a 30 minute walk away.

He will use the money from this loan toward his harvest because he has to prepare and store his grain.  He wants his harvest to be abundant for his family’s consumption and for sale.  He will use that income to fix up his kitchen.

loans.use: to harvest his grain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains and do maintenance.

loans.name: Surobala

texts.en:
Surobala is a 41-year-old housewife in the village of Magurmari in Dhupguri. She has her only son, Kartik, and husband, Kanchan, in her family. Her husband is a van-puller, and both she and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Her son is studying in class VI (grade 6) in a village school.

Her husband hires a van from a local owner and carries goods and people from one place to another in his remote area. That is why his income is very inconsistent. Being almost fatigued due to low income, Surobala is about to defer her son’s education, though her son, Kartik, is very much sincere with his studies. He himself learns his lessons and goes to school regularly. 

So, seeing his attentiveness, Surobala decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to give support to her son’s education by purchasing books, pens and other educational equipment to give support to her son. She wishes that she could also be able to give him private tuition with the help of this loan, which will provide him a better standard of education.

Surobala and her son, Kartik (standing beside Surobala in the photo), heartily express their gratitude to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to afford the expenses for her son’s education.

loans.name: Gayatri

texts.en:
Gayatri is a 40-year-old woman who is blessed with her only daughter, Shefali, 16 years old. They live in Altagram village of Dhupguri. Shefali reads in class X (grade 10) and is preparing herself for the board examination. She didn’t get any educational help from her parents because both of them are illiterate and only can sign their names.

Gayatri’s husband is a farmer, and his income is hardly enough for their family’s expenditures. Gayatri is almost unable to contribute to her daughter’s education and provide private tuition to her daughter. Due to this, Shefali might have to face great problems in her forthcoming exam. 

Gayatri applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay her daughter’s school fees, private tuition fees and purchase her study materials to give her a bright future with a good education. She hopes to make her only child highly qualified so that her daughter can support them financially in the future to lead a decent lifestyle.

She and her daughter Shefali (as in the picture) are thanking BJS and Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to pay for school fees, private tuition fees and necessary educational equipment for her daughter’s schooling.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a mother of two children. Her son is in class VIII (grade 8) and her daughter in class VII (grade 7) in their village, Altagram, of Dhupguri. Being an illiterate woman (she can sign her name only), she always tries to give an education to her children. Her husband is involved in farming vegetables to sell in the village market, and she assists him on their farmland.

Her daughter, Sujata, has been promoted to class VII this year and studies hard to compete with her classmates. Sumitra wants to pay for her daughter’s schooling fees, but she does not have enough money, so she is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She knows that she can use this fund to bear the expenses related to her daughter’s higher education. With the support of this loan, Sumitra can also provide private tuition to her daughter for better education.

She and her daughter, Sujata (in the photo), are highly obliged to BJS and Kiva because BJS, as well as Kiva lenders fund, help Sujata to expand her outreach to be an even more educated and highly qualified person in Dhupguri.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s schooling fees, as well as private tuition fees for her education.

loans.name: Putul

texts.en:
Putul is a rural housewife from the small village of Promodnagar in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and seven children (five sons and two daughters). Six of the children are receiving education. They are in grade 10, grade 9, grade 6 and grade 3; one is in college. The eldest son has a job with a building contractor. Putul is 47 years old and her husband is 51 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in their own house.

Putul's husband is a farmer. To take care of the family's needs, he is extensively engaged in agriculture and in the cultivation of onions and green vegetables. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family, but it has become very difficult for him to support a seven member family with his small income.

In order to continue developing their agribusiness in a sustainable way and at the same time cultivate potatoes on their farmland, Putul needs to make some investments. She has taken out a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). She will use the loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. She has chosen this business as the product has great demand in the present market.

Putul dreams this business will enable her to earn extra profit which will give financial support to her family to fulfill their basic needs and educate the children properly.

Putul sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hire a worker to fix her home.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Maynaguri with her two children and her husband. Both she and her husband are illiterate, but can sign their names only. Her children are engaged with their education. 

Maya’s husband pulls a rickshaw in her locality, and his income is very inconsistent; it totally depends on the demand of the local people. She contributes to her family by working as a daily labourer, which also provides no prospect to succeed in the financial aspect of life, so she decided to start a new business of dairy products. 

She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow to start her own business of selling milk and dairy products in her locality. Maya is very courageous and ambitious to start her new business and hopes she will be able to give a bright future to her children with the profit from this business.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for giving her the financial assistance to start a new business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and dairy products.

loans.name: Teofilo Jose

texts.es: Don Teofilo se dedica a la actividad minera, compra  broza o material para procesar el oro lo cual es (tierra con partículas de oro), que lleva al  molino para extraer el oro y ser comercializado, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de la misma, de esta manera mantiene a su familia con el apoyo de su esposa quien es comerciante, ambos tienen 4 hijos todos estudian, los dos más grandecitos después de su estudio le ayudan con el quehacer del hogar.
texts.en: Don Teofilo is a miner and purchases material in order to process gold (soil with particles of gold in it) and carry it to the mill where they extract the gold in order to be later sold. The loan he is asking for will be used to purchase these materials and help him to be able to support his family along with help from his wife, who is a trader. They have 4 children who all go to school and the two oldest help with chores around the house after they are done with schoolwork.

loans.use: purchase materials to process gold in order to sell it.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a woman who has two children and lives in the countryside at Maynaguri, in Jalpaiguri district. Her husband works as a daily laborer. His income is not sufficient to run the family properly.

Malati is a 46-year-old lady with many dreams and who is eager to overcome the problems and get ahead in her life alongside her family members. She plans to help her family financially. She decided to start cultivating tea plants on their own plot of land, so she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase tea saplings and fertilizers for cultivation of tea. 

Selling tea leaves is a profitable business, and there is a good demand in their locality and in the present market, so she hopes to earn a good profit from her business.

She hopes to upgrade their financial condition and give better education and a better future to her children with the profit that she generates from the business. In the future, she also wants to purchase a cow with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase tea saplings and fertilizers for cultivating tea plants.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila es una señora casada de 28 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella comenta que se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica en el lugar de su domicilio. Eligió esta actividad porque tiene una fuerte demanda, ya que las mujeres de su comunidad lo utilizan. A través de la labor que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia.
Ahora lleva dos años de realizar esta actividad que cada vez es más productiva en cuanto a la generación de ganancias, de manera que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 1,000.00 para la compra de hilos, jaspeado y otros artículos para la elaboración de estas prendas típicas.
Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila is 28 years old, married, and lives with her three children in the department of Sololá. She reports that she makes typical clothing and works from home. She chose this activity because it is in high demand because all the women in her region wear these kind of clothes. Through her work, she is able to earn enough money to support her family. 
She has now been involved in this activity for two years and it proves to be more and more productive over time. And so, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase threads, precious stones and other items she uses to make typical clothing items. Her dream is to be able to get her children ahead in their schooling and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase threads, precious stones and other items to make typical clothing.

loans.name: Ajija

texts.en:
Ajija lives in a small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a 45-year-old housewife who is uneducated and can only sign her name. She is a courageous housewife and blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter). They are students of grade 9, grade 10 and grade 11 respectively.

Her husband, Samsul, 50 years old, sells betel nuts (used as mouth fresheners) in the local market. He grows them on their own land. Ajija also helps her husband to run the business. They have had trouble accessing financing and still don't have a building to host the store, so they sell their goods either on a cloth in the market or door to door in the village. The income from this business is so scanty that it is hardly possible for them to maintain their family in a sustainable way.

Ajija has decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, which gives small loans to rural women to start businesses. She will use the loan to purchase more betel nut plants and grow them on their land; then sell the betel nuts in their locality and local bazaar.

She hopes to earn extra profit from this business. Together, she and her husband will be able to increase their savings and buy a proper shop in the near future. In the meantime, she also hopes to use the profits to help her children get a good education and become independent.

In the future, they desire to purchase a van for their own use and to give it on hire for another means of income.

They are thankful to their lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to buy more betel nut plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Ivonne Fabiola

texts.es: la señora Ivonne, continua con sus planes a futuro, el credito lo solita para la compra de Materiales como: Bloques, Cemento, Puerta, con esto mejorara la parte trasera de su vivienda ya que esta hecha de Zinc y ella quiere mas seguridad para su familia sobretodo por su hijo. Agredece el apoyo que siempre le han brindado.
texts.en: Ivonne continues with her plans for the future. The loan she is requesting is to buy materials like cinder blocks, cement and a door. This is to improve the back part of her house which is made of zinc and Ivonne wants more security for her family, especially her child. She is grateful for the assistance offered.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Tarina

texts.en:
Tarina is a rural housewife from the small village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 44 years old and an illiterate woman who can only sign her name.  She is married to Kafir, who is 52 years old, uneducated and works as a labourer on a daily wages basis under a building contractor. They are raising three children (two sons and one daughter). One of them is school-going, and the other two are engaged in business.

Tarina’s husband has been doing this work for a long time. He is the main source of income for the family. To help her husband to run the family well, Tarima is also running an animal husbandry. She is a hardworking and ambitious lady who works hard from dawn to dusk to give financial assistance to her family, but is unable to do so. Their small income is the main hindrance to the wellbeing of her family.

Thus, they have decided to purchase one more cow for their animal husbandry.  Tarina has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a cow and start a dairy products business (milk, paneer, cheese, butter and curd). They have chosen this business because the products have a good market, and they chose BJS (Kiva’s partner) for the loan because they meet the needs of small-scale farmers.
