Phally (in the photo) is 55 years old, and lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two sons - one is married and lives separately and another one works for a restaurant. Her husband is a security guard and drives a motor taxi when he is free. 

Phally stays at home. The main source of income is from her son’s salary from the restaurant, and from her husband. Her son commutes to the restaurant by driving his old motorcycle. The old motorbike is breaking down and uses more gasoline.

So, Phally decided to apply for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her son.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her son to drive for work.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase materials needed in making gloves, like cloth, fabric, needles, and other materials. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy materials needed in making gloves, like cloth, fabric, needles, and other materials. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leonila hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed in making gloves, like cloth, fabric, needles, and other materials.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en: Claude is a Cameroonian aged thirty-one who is married with a child of two years. He has been in the retail business for over four years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be us to increase his turnover by thirty five percent. His standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy eyeglasses, belts, and some electronics for resale.

loans.name: Som Ul

texts.en:
Som Ul (pictured above) is a garment worker, while her husband is a retired soldier and is now a motor taxi driver. 

She lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She has three children - two sons and one daughter. One of her children is a garment worker, and the other two are in school. 

Som Ul is applying for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school. Recently, Som Ul’s children have been commuting to school by taking a motor remoque (a motorbike with a trailer at the back), which is not on time for them.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase feeds and additional hogs needed for his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs needed for his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Vicente hopes that his business will continue to expand and dreams to give his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. There, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feeds and additional hogs needed for his business.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna (pictured) is 35 years old and a widowed mother with one young daughter. She lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers outside Phnom Penh City. 

Vanna is a garment worker. She does not have her own transportation to get to work; therefore she spends lots of money on travelling costs very often. 

Facing this, Vanna decided to request a loan in order to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Philomina's Group

texts.en:
Philomina, who is in her mid 40's, is married with two children; all of them go to school. She has been a fish seller for nine years. She works from 5:00a.m. to 6:00p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Philomina's fifth loan from ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. She used the previous loans to buy fish to boost her business. She has a very presentable location where she sells her products and gets more customers. She is really doing fine. She is grateful for the loan. She has repaid all her previous loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, expand her business, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more fish.  

Philomina will share this loan amount of GHS 7300 with her loan group which has a total of eight members who will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

They will use it to buy eggs, plastic items, cutlery sets, maize, and charcoal etc.

loans.use: to buy more fish, and sell to customers.

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
This is Novel, 50, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and they have children. Novel and her husband manage their household while operating their business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Novel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Novel dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.


*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire labor.

loans.name: Jeimy Alexandra

texts.es: Ella es Jeimy Alexandra, una adolescente de 17 años soñadora, fuerte,  dedicada, cumplida, organizada, respetuosa y con muchas aspiraciones, que a pesar de las circunstancias y adversidades en las que se encuentre siempre lo supera y logra salir adelante con la frente en alto sin pasar por encima de los principios fundamentados en el hogar, donde convive con la madre de 33 años, quien en este momento  la guía y el único apoyo moral y económico, con el pequeño hijo de mes y medio quien en este momento es el motor y motivación para ser una persona de ejemplo y de bien,  tiene una hermana de 15 años quien la visita los fines de semana por motivos netamente familiares y de preferencias escolares, un hermano de 11 años que en este momento vive en la cuidad de Caquetá con el padre, por la propia decisión con el que tiene contacto por teléfono y en visitas de vacaciones, esta adolescente se encuentra cursando grado once en el colegio Robert Hooke, un colegio semestralizado ya que por adversidades de la vida y por el acompañamiento directo para el hijo es lo más cómodo y conveniente, también se encuentra a punto de iniciar el cuarto semestre de auxiliar de enfermería en el instituto campo alto;  Jeimy Alexandra elige esta carrera de auxiliar en enfermería ya que es lo que le apasiona y le ha servido de ejemplo de superación de la madre quien labora actualmente en dicha profesión y sustenta el hogar, además piensa y aspira que esta carrera a futuro le pueda  servir para ayudarla económicamente, y como principio  sacar a el hijo que tiene adelante y continuar con los estudios sobre medicina pediátrica, en este momento esta adolescente requiere el convenio kiva ya que no tiene los recursos económicos suficientes para terminar esta etapa de la vida, además para lograr las aspiraciones educativas  ya que depende económicamente de la madre quien no solo solventa el estudio de ella sino el de los dos hermanos y ahora del nieto, Jeimy Alexandra es dedicada y ama lo que hace solo necesita una mano que le ayude a seguir pensando que la vida no se detiene por un obstáculo, quiere ser una auxiliar dedicada y humana para no solo curar aspectos físicos sino personales de quienes el día de mañana se convertirán en los pacientes, todo lo que se realice de corazón será recompensado, ella quiere ser como el ejemplo vivo de la mama, quiere ser una excelente profesional y brindar los conocimientos a quien lo necesite,  tomar esta profesión como trampolín para lograr la superación personal y el plan de vida, solo espera un impulso y una mano amiga.
texts.en:
This is Jeimy Alexandra, a 17 year old dreamer.  She is strong, dedicated, committed, organized, respectful and with great aspirations.  Despite the circumstances and adversities that she finds herself in, she always succeeds and manages to get ahead with her head held high and without giving up her fundamental principles.  She lives with her 33 year old mother who guides her and is her only source of moral and financial support for her and her one and a half month old son who is the engine for her motivation to become a person who sets the example.  She also has a 15 year old sister who visits them on the weekends because of school, and an 11 year old brother who lives with his father in Caqueta.  He stays in touch by phone and visits during vacations.  He is in 11th grade and attends Robert Hooke, a seminary school which is in his best interest given life’s adversities.

She is also about to begin her fourth semester as a nursing assistant student.  Jeimy Alexandra chose this career path because she is passionate about it and has shown herself as an example to her mother who currently works in said profession.  She aspires toward this career and in the future wants to support her financially. 

She also wants to get her son ahead and continue her studies in pediatric medicine.  This adolescent young woman needs a Kiva loan because she doesn’t have the financial resources to complete this stage of her life.  She also has educational aspirations and depends on her mother financially, who not only pays for her education but also her two siblings’ and grandson.

Jeimy Alexandra is dedicated and loves what she does, but needs a hand and continues to believe that she will not halt her life because of an obstacle.  She wants to be a dedicated assistant and human being so she can not only treat physical afflictions, but also personal ones for her future patients.  What she gives of her heart will be rewarded.  She wants to be an example for her mother, become an excellent professional, and help those in need.  She is jumping into this profession to succeed personally and in her life’s plan.  She only needs a helping hand.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, age 40, lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with one son and two daughters. Two of her children are garment workers, and another one attends school. Phally is now a garment worker, and she also hires her fellow villagers to grow rice for her. 

She wants to build a concreted brick room under her wooden house where it is easy for her to have things or elements. So, she decided to apply for a loan to use for that purpose.

loans.use: to build a concreted brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es: La señora Mary de veinticinco años de edad tiene una hija a su cargo, es una persona trabajadora,  vive en el área rural, se dedica a la producción de hortalizas como ser papa, oca, cebada y otros; desde muy pequeña aprendió la actividad de la agricultura, vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad que van a las ferias de la comunidad, sus productos son bien demandados ya que son alimentos de primera necesidad, actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar semilla ya que está en etapa de siembra, además esta incrementando su producción porque esta dispuesta a diversificar debido a que los productos que cosechan del lugar son altamente demandados debido a la tierra y los minerales naturales que brinda la misma, de esta forma incrementara sus ingresos y podrá ofrecerle a su familia mayor bienestar.
texts.en: Mary is 28 years old and has a daughter.  She is a hardworking lady, lives in a rural area, and raises vegetables such as potatoes, okra, onions, and other things.  She learned farming when she was very young and sells her harvest to wholesalers in town who visit the local fairs.  Her products are in demand because they are primary needs items.   She is asking for a loan to buy seeds because this is planting season.  She is also increasing her production because she wants to diversify her products are in high demand given the rich soil.  This way she will increase her income and provide better wellbeing for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Veronica Temilda

texts.es:
Verónica, es soltera, tiene 22 años de edad vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.

SE dedica a la venta de ropa. Solicita el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico. vende la ropra en el mercado de Chimbo. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar sus bienes. Su desafío es la competencia. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.  En el tiempo libre  le gusta  estudiar.
texts.en:
Veronica is single and 22 years old. She lives with her parents in the canton of Chimbo, in the province of Bolívar. 

She makes a living by selling clothing. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase a major household appliance. She sells the clothing in the market of Chimbo. With the support of the loan she will be able to purchase her goods. Her challenge is the competition. Her dream is to have good health so she can continue working. In her free time she likes to study.

loans.use: to purchase a major household appliance

loans.name: Elisa Magdalena

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera vive  en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Se dedica a la agricultura,a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  Las  compras lo realizan  Chimbo en el comercial Prado cada semana.  Su sueño es comprarse un terreno. Su desafío es la competencia.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta caminar.
texts.en:
Elisa is 47 years old. She is single and lives in the canton of Chimbo in the province of Los Ríos.

She makes a living from agriculture; she sows corn. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizers, supplies, and compost. With the support of the loan she will be able to purchase the fertilizers. She makes her purchases every week in Chimbo in the shopping area of Prado. Her dream is to buy a plot of land for herself. Her challenge is the competition. In her free time she likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Dúo Rositas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Rositas de san Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por Gladys Anabella, ella tiene 36 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de refacciones, en su cafetería, como venta de hamburguesa, chéveres, hot dog, café, cereales, café con leche, licuados, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de una licuadora,  y una cafetera, Y productos de abarrotes, para surtir su cafetería, su anhelo es seguir surtiendo su cafetería y mejorar sus ventas y sobre todo el ingreso de su hogar,esta muy agradesida por la ayuda que le han brindado y espera que le sigan ayudando en su negocio.
texts.en: This pair was formed by Gladys Anabella. She is 36 years old and she makes a living by selling light refreshments in her coffee shop, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, coffee, cereal, and smoothies. She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of a blender, a coffee machine, and groceries for stocking her business. Her wish is to continue stocking her coffee shop, improving her sales, and above all improving her household income. She is very grateful for the help you have given her and she hopes that you will continue helping her with her business.

loans.use: to purchase a blender and a coffee machine for her business

loans.name: Rosette

texts.fr: La cliente Rosette est agent dans une organisation international humanitaire. Elle est parent d’une étudiante inscrite régulièrement à l’université. Elle a été informée de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques de son enfant pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour sa jeune fille et souhaite la voir devenir Juriste, Défenseur de droits humains, cadre d’entreprise, professeur d’université, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Rosette, is a woman who specializes in the culinary arts in an international humanitarian organization. 

She is the parent of one student who is regularly enrolled in university. 

She was informed of new educational loan opportunities from IMF Hekima that can be used to pay school fees in advance. She will use this loan to pay her children’s school fees so that they will no longer be excluded from classes in the 2013-2014 school year.

This parent dreams of a better future for her daughter and would like to see her become a lawyer, business executive, university professor, member of parliament, etc.

In the end, she would like to recognize Hekima’s special initiative, and especially this social impact project during this period of reconstruction in the east of the country.

loans.use: payer les frais académiques de son enfant

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 60 años de edad, es un hombre casado padre de tres hijos, de los cuales estudian octavo y noveno grado, él solamente logro estudiar quinto grado ya que le quedaba muy lejos para ir a estudiar, él se dedica desde hace más de veintinueve años a la agricultura  y sus hijos dependen de él.

Oscar cultiva la tierra, sembrando granos básicos y también se dedica al comercio de ganado y aprendió este negocio por su papá que le enseño este oficio. Viaja varios kilómetros desde  su casa al trabajo, pero lo hace a caballo su trabajo le demanda hacerlo todos los días de  la semana, su familia le apoya en lo que sea necesario.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para seguir trabajando la tierra, los cultivos de frijol y maíz, también comprara algunas aves, ya que con estas actividades satisface sus necesidades diarias y de su familia ya que gran parte la consume y la otra la vende.

Los sueños de Oscar son ver crecer sus hijos de forma ordena, que se superen, que tengan un buen futuro, dejarlos en buen terreno para que construyan su casa y que tengan un buen trabajo que les permita realizarse en la vida.
texts.en:
60-year-old Oscar is a married man and the father of three children, who are in eighth and ninth grade at school. He only managed to study until the fifth grade since school was a long way from his home. He has made a living from agriculture for more than 29 years and his children depend on him.

Oscar cultivates the land, planting staple grains, and he also makes a living by selling livestock. He learnt this business from his father, who taught him the trade. He travels several kilometres to get from home to work by horse. His work demands that he be there every day of the week, and his family help him when necessary.

The loan he is requesting is for continuing to work the land, his bean and corn crops, and for the purchase of some poultry. With these activities he satisfies his daily needs and those of his family as well since they consume most of the crops and then sell the rest.

Oscar’s dreams are to see his children grow up normally, get ahead, and have a good future; to leave his children a good piece of land so they can build a house; and for his children to have good jobs which will allow them to establish themselves in life.

loans.use: to continue working the land and planting his bean and corn crops, and to purchase some poultry

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en: Mrs. Byambaa, 56 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been running public toilet since 2007 and before this service, she had worked as cook at restaurant. Using her previous loan, she has purchased furniture and created comfortable living environment. This time she is requesting a loan of 1400000 MNT to remove human wastes from toilet before weather gets warm. As a result, she can avoid concentration of human wastes and prevent them from spilling into environment. Also it will decrease the awful odor of toilet.

loans.use: To remove human wastes from toilets

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar is 34 years old, single and lives with his parents. Today they are living in the Fuzuli region, but 21 years ago their motherland Fuzuli city was occupied by Armenians, and since then they are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons).  

Anar is engaged and this year wants to get married. He rents a store and in this store he sells mixed goods. He wants to increase his lovely business. For this reason he has applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 1700 AZN (Azerbaijam New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy more products. 

In the future, he wants to buy a bigger store to increase his business. In his personal life, he wants to get married and have a child. Anar is thankful to Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store.

loans.name: Akili Group

texts.fr: La cliente Fatuma est présidente dans le groupe de credit Akili. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 50 ans et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés.Elle est mariée à un homme sans emploie. Elle sollicite le nouveau crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de braises pour augmenter son entreprise. Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et assurer une très bonne vie à sa famille. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien surtout pendant cette période de post conflit en RDC.
texts.en: The client Fatuma is president of the credit group Akili. A dynamic woman, she is 50 years old and mother of 4 children, all students. Elle is married to a man who is unemployed. She seeks a new loan to buy 10 bags of coals for her stock. She wants to prosper in her business and ensure a good life for her family. Thus, she thanks Hekima for supporting them especially in this post conflict period.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of coals

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr:
Penda, une dame de 35 ans, fait du commerce depuis maintenant 6 ans. Elle est mariée et vit avec sa belle famille. Elle vend des coussins, des draps de lit, des tissus, des chaussures. Elle est à son troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’honorer une commande de coussins de petite, moyenne et grande taille comme on le voit sur la photo. Penda écoule sa marchandise en faisant l’ambulante mais elle peut aussi recevoir des commandes. Grâce aux emprunts, elle augmente la quantité de sa marchandise et donc, maximise ses bénéfices. 
Elle veut développer son commerce à tel point qu’elle n’aura même plus besoin de solliciter des crédits auprès des institutions de micro-finances.
texts.en:
Penda, a 35-year-old woman, has been in business for six years now. She is married and lives with her in-laws. She sells cushions, bedsheets, cloth, and shoes. She is on her third loan enabling her to fulfill an order for small, medium, and large-sized cushions or pillows, as seen in the photo. Penda hawks her goods, but she may also receive special orders. Thanks to loans, she is increasing the amount of merchandise, thus maximizing her profits. 

She wants to develop her business to a point where she will no longer need to request loans from microfinance institutions.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, shoes, and bed sheets and to make cushions to resell

loans.name: Murvat

texts.en:
Murvat is 55 years old ex-military. He is married and has two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper. Murvat’s family are IDP (internally displaced persons) and they have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. He earns money raising fruits and vegetables and selling them at the local bazaar. The monthly income is 150 AZN and he has 15 years experience in this area.

Demand for fruits and vegetables is very high. Every day they use them to prepare different kinds of fruit juice and jam and vegetable salads. People used to buy from private gardens because the food there costs cheaper than in markets. 

Murvat wants to make his family’s life better. Especially, he wants to provide for his daughters' future. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy more fertilizers and fruit tree seeds to increase his income. This is his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and fruit tree seeds.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a married woman who was born in 1977. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She decided to help her husband financially by providing hair-do (hair dressing) services to her customers and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy wigs in a larger quantity to raise her profit. She also wants to help her husband to take care of the three children. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan amount of GHS 800 and this is her first loan with Kiva and second loan with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to buy wigs in a larger quantity to sell to customers

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is a 50-years-old woman who cultivates rice in Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. She lives simply with her spouse and three of her children who are unmarried; her oldest child is married and lives separately. An pays full attention to her rice farming business with great support from her husband and children as it is the sole source of her family’s income. Through her sacrifices and efforts, she can earn approximately USD $5.31 per day for the family’s daily needs.

She is requesting a loan amounting to USD $630 to build a safe latrine for her household. Having the additional capital she requested will be a great help for her in sanitation improvement practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), An is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for her household.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more merchandise products for her direct selling business and her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also sells different fruits for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar products

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en:
Mairam is a freshman in the Psychology program and this is her story:
In the age of technology most of the people are more interested in making money and managing their time. Less people are able to pay their attention to their family, to their children, to their relatives and friends. Such things as quarrels, fatigue, irritability, stress and misunderstandings are common nowadays. We are not surprised by the huge amount of divorce, crime, alcoholism, drug addiction etc. I believe, the human being deserves better life and I want to help people to prevent them facing such situations.

I want to become a psychologist. Being a psychologist I can help people morally if not materially, advising what to do in difficult times, where to get support and explaining the reasons for those problems. As we know, especially orphans, disabled and old people are in need of psychologist. I wish to show them the right path to go through, make it clear that the future depends on oneself, because one’s fate is in his/her own hands.

I have studied one year the preparatory “New Generation Academy” program at AUCA and made sure that AUCA is what I need. It is the recognizable and well proven educational and scientific brand. Thousands of university graduates are successfully working in Kyrgyzstan and abroad, and I wish to be one of them.

loans.use: to pay for my higher tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Tilek

texts.en:
Tilek is a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics program, this is his story:

I have great interest in diplomacy and my goal is to work in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, or perhaps in governmental political intelligence. It goes without saying that my choice is connected with my country. Kyrgyzstan needs a clear political course and I want to contribute to the development of democratic reforms in my country, which in the future will pave the way to economic and political stability in the region. Therefore I feel the enthusiasm to work in this area and contribute to the formation of strong Kyrgyzstan.

ICP program of AUCA is necessary for me to have a clear and fair view of the balance of power in the modern political game and to broaden my horizons. I often see successful graduates of the ICP program and see that AUCA perfectly copes with this task.

AUCA has rich material and information base and experienced teaching staff, so I did not hesitate in choosing this university. A general atmosphere of friendship and mutual support of AUCA motivates me a lot to study here.

loans.use: to pay for my higher education

loans.name: Margery

texts.en:
This is Margery, 35, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, a driver, and they have children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Margery maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than the prices in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Margery dreams that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to be in good health always. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her income from her business is assisting with her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Francisca dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Umutai

texts.en:
Umutai is a student of the American University of Central Asia (AUCA), department of European Studies and here is her story:

I am learning French and German and politics classes that are interesting to me. Being a future specialist in Europe gives many advantages, such as participation in European summer schools, conferences, or pursuing a Master Degree. Europe is a global political and economic center that exerts enormous international influence. I want to have a career in a supranational organization or in a national organization that are active internationally.

Studying at European Studies is really interesting and it has a lot of perspectives for me. As there are many old people, who need a shelter, and the amount of orphans is increasing year by year, my aim is to work for the EU or NGOs of Europe in Kyrgyzstan by organizing such projects as: Rehabilitation centres in every corner of my country, nursing homes and orphanages. 

AUCA is the most active and most successful University in Central Asia in researching and participation in these kinds of international academic activities and I am too thankful to be part of it thanks to your help.

loans.use: to pay for my higher education

loans.name: Isis Jackeline

texts.es:
Isis, es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres, para dar su ayuda económica en su hogar se dedica a atender la tienda que instalo en su residencia, abre sus puertas al público de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en administrarla.
Isis invertirá en la compra de sal, azúcar, granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, pan, entre otro tipo de mercadería para dar a sus clientes mejores posibilidades de encontrar lo que necesitan en su tienda, espera fortalecer lo necesario el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
Sueña con tener una economía más estable que le facilite el pago de cuotas y el mejoramiento del estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Isis is single and without children. She lives with her parents in order to give some economic assistance in their home. She is dedicated to attending the store installed in their residence. The doors are open to the public from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m and until now she has not had any problem in administrating it. 

Isis will invest in the purchase of salt, sugar, basic grains, drinks, sweets and bread among other types of merchandise in order to give her customers a better chance at finding what they need in her store. She hopes to strengthen the necessary things in the business to improve her income. She dreams of having a more stable economy, which will facilitate the payment of bills and the improvement of her family lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, basic grains, drinks, sweets and bread.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is married and has one adult child. He is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He grows and sells rice, which he has been doing for more than 10 years. This is the source of his income.

Jacinto is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and medicine and pay a laborer's fee. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his yield and income. In the future, Jacinto hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine and pay a laborer's fee

loans.name: Ma. Rowena

texts.en:
Ma. Rowena is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the recyclable materials needed in her junk shop. Her income from the business is assisting her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan to buy recyclable materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Rowena dreams of being more successful in business and hopes that her family will be in good condition always. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maricela de 32 años de edad, es acompañada, tiene dos hijos pequeños uno asiste al kinder, su pareja trabaja y ella se dedica a vender atol todos los días, sus hijos dependen de ella directamente, vive junto con sus padres y ellos le ayudan a cuidar a sus dos hijos. Ella vende atol todas las mañanas, además de eso vende cuadros religiosos y se ha dedicado a este negocio por más de cinco años su madre  le enseño este tipo de actividad, su puesto de negocio le queda un poco cerca como a un kilómetro  y su  familia le ayuda ocasionalmente en el negocio.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar màs cuadros y artículos religiosos, porque en esta temporada es cuando más vende sus productos y lograra mejores beneficio. El negocio le será más rentable  para obtener mejores ganancias y por supuesto la calidad de vida también y la de su familia.

Sus sueños son el de darle a sus hijos lo mejor, que estudien y que sean profesionales el día de mañana y que tengan un buen trabajo y se puedan defenderse por si solos, también sueña con tener una vivienda amplia y piensa que con las ganancias que genere el negocio lo lograra poco a poco, trabajando de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
Maricela is 32 years old and married. She has two small children, one in kindergarten. Her partner works and Maricela sells atole [a typical corn-based, spiced hot drink] every day. Her children are directly dependent on her. They live with her parents, who help her to care for her two children. She sells atol every morning, and she sells religious paintings as well. She has been in this business for more than five years; her mother taught it to her. Her place of business is near home, about a kilometer away, and her family helps her in the business sometimes.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more paintings and religious items, because at this time of year is when she sells the most products and she will achieve a greater benefit. The business will be more profitable to her, so she can make a better profit, and of course, improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

Her dreams are giving the best to her children, that they study and that in the future they will be professionals and have a good job and be able to take care of themselves independently. She also dreams of having a large home, and her idea is that, with the profits from her business, little by little she will manage it, by working the best she can.

loans.use: to buy more paintings and religious articles

loans.name: Edison Orley

texts.es:
Edison tiene 24 años de edad, su estado civil casado, tiene una hija de dos años, vive con su esposa e hija  en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar. 

Edison se dedica a la cría de chanchos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de balanceado para los animales.  Las  compras lo realizan  en Chimbo cada semana en el Comercial Prado.  Su sueño es tener casa propia. Su desafío es la competencia.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edison, 24, is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the Chimbo Canton in the province of Bolivar.

Edison raises pigs and is requesting a loan to buy balanced animal feed.  He makes his purchases in Chimbo every week at Comercial Prado.  His goal is to have his own home.  Competition is his main challenge in business.  In his free time he enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es: Félix habita en la comunidad de flor de pino  tiene 43 años  en esta comunidad y cerca de su casa viven suS hermanos y su mama a los que los apoya económicamente cuando él puede  ya que  el también ya tiene su propia familia su esposa y  4 hijos. Los que lucha para darles el sustento diario Nos comenta que el con esfuerzo de trabajo de años  se hizo  de su propia  propiedad en la que tiene sembrado café y cosecha granos básicos sus hijos mayores lo apoyan  en los labores del campo, el desde pequeños les ha enseñado a trabajar honradamente además este  será el  patrimonio que él les heredara.   Dice que su mayor fuente de ingreso es la cosecha de café  pues hay años que se vende bien.  Dice que en la comunidad no  hay energía eléctrica y el quisiera tener luz en su hogar para que la condición de vida de su familia mejore  ya que actualmente usan candil y candelas  por las noches es por eso que está haciendo la gestión de crédito   para comprar un sistema solar.
texts.en:
Félix has lived 43 years in the community Flor de Pino.  Near his home live his siblings and mother who he helps out economically when he can.  He is married and has four children and works hard to support them.  He says that by struggling over the years he has his own land where he grows coffee and basic grains.  His eldest children help with the farm work as they were taught from a young age to work honestly and that one day they will inherit the land.

Félix says his greatest source of income is the coffee that he has been selling for several years.  There is no electricity in his community and he would like to improve the family lifestyle by adding light.  Now they use lanterns and candles at night.  So he is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Don Carlos padre de familia de 6 hijos, todos mayores e independientes, su esposa es ama de casa y el es maestro de natación en una escuela. En la actualidad don Carlos desea terminar de hacer el baño y las divisiones de cuarto en su casa, motivo por el cual solicita el crédito para poder comprar los materiales y empezar la obra que viene a brindar comodidad en el hogar para la familia.
texts.en: Carlos is the father of six children, all of whom are adults and independent.  His wife is a homemaker and he is a swimming teacher at a school.  Carlos currently wants to finish the bathroom and put up some walls in the house.  He is requesting a loan to buy the materials to start the project which will make home life more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, iron and blocks.

loans.name: Rocio Margarita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rocío, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  23, 19 y 10 años, los dos menores  estudian en universidad y escuela y son los que aun vive con ella. Su esposo se comerciante.
Doña Rocío y su esposo tienen un local en el centro de la ciudad en el cual se dedican a la venta de todo tipo de repuestos y accesorios de teléfonos celulares, así como recargas, planes y teléfonos, ella también se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella vende en su local y también ciertos días sale a recorrer por la ciudad donde tiene sus clientes. Tiene 3 años con este local mientras que en sus ventas mucho más.
Este crédito es para comprar teléfonos, repuestos y  ropa. Lleva 15 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que los arriendos se le llevan gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "3 de Mayo" meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa Canton which is known as the "Sultana del Café"  (coffee queen) because of its extensive plantations and outstandingly delicious coffee, gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

This is where Rocío, 39, lives.  She is married and has three children, ages 23, 19, and 10.  The youngest two, who live at home, attend the university and school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Rocío and her husband rent a shop in the city where they sell all kinds of spare parts and accessories for cell phones, prepayment plans and phones.  She also sells clothing by catalogue and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She sells at the shop and also goes out some days to visit customers.  For three years she has been working out of the shop but has been in business much longer.

This loan is to buy phones, spare parts and clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 15 years and she likes it because thanks to the loans she was able to start her business.  Her dream is to have her own shops because paying rent takes a good part of her profit.

loans.use: To buy telephones, spare parts and clothing.

loans.name: Makouta's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois été mise en place le 28 juillet 2009  lors de son inauguration. Il est composé de femmes qui partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont aussi comme objectif commun de faire avancer leur groupement via le programme et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation de produits agricoles.

Madame Makouta (assise à droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 62 ans, mariée  et mère de  sept enfants dont  trois filles et quatre garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans l’achat et la vente de kola et de tabac non raffiné, ce dernier est acheté dans un pays frontalier pour la revente dans les marchés hebdomadaires surtout au grand marché international de la sous région.
 
Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter : 20 Kg de kola à 1 500 F CFA le kg et 03 kg de tabac à 6 000 F CFA le kg. 

Les bénéfices, d’une part sont reconduits dans l’activité pour le renforcer et d’autre part elle les utilisera pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was established on July 28, 2009 when it was inaugurated. It is made up of women who share values of solidarity and mutual assistance. They also share a common goal: to move their group forward through the loan program. Their main businesses are retail and transformation of farming products. 

Mrs. Makouta (sitting on the left and raising her hand in the photograph) is the group's featured borrower. She's 62 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, three girls and four boys.

Her business consists in buying and selling kola and unrefined tobacco, which she buys in a neighboring country and resell during the weekly markets, especially at the large international market of her subregion.

This new loan will enable her to buy 20 kg of kola at XOF 1'500 per kg, and 3 kg of tobacco at XOF 6'000 per kg. Her profits will be in part reinvested in her business to bolster it, and in part used to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 kg of kola and 3 kg of tobacco

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 61 years old and lives in Dilijan city. It is already 15 years that Vardan has been in the fruit-vegetable sale business. With his own car, Vardan drives around the whole city and sells a great variety of vegetables and fruits such as cucumber, tomato, greens, potato carrot, orange, mandarin, banana, apple, and grapes etc.  He buys these vegetables and fruits from the villagers once a week. This occupation is the main source of income for his small family. Vardan’s car is very important for his work and his family and he takes care of it very properly.  Vardan is married and has a son.
Vardan asks a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams in order to do some urgent repair works on his car.

loans.use: to do some urgent repair works on his car which he needs for his business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy fertilizer and garden inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and garden inputs needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs and her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn hopes to continuously expand her business and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, seeds and garden inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
This is Irenea, aged 55 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ignacio, her business partner and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Irenea operates a market stall. She sells different vegetables and seasonings needed in her business. She buys a quantity of fruits and vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy different vegetables and different seasonings needed in her business.

Irenea dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different vegetables and different seasonings needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doña Maria es habitante de la comunidad  flor de pino ella ha vivido  ahí toda su vida 51 años de edad  es casada tiene 6 hijos la mayoría de ellos ya se han casado y tienen su  propia familia  los dos varones que son los menores  estudian en la escuela de la comunidad  se siente muy contenta verlos estudia pues quiere se preparen. Su forma de recibir ingresos es con la siembra  de granos básicos  que estos una vez que la cosecha sale los comercializa y otra parte la deja para consumo del hogar  además también trabaja en haciendas grandes que hay en la comunidad  así puede recibir otros ingresos sobre todo en la temporada de corte de café. En la comunidad aún no hay energía eléctrica ella dice  ya haberse  acostumbrado  a estar a oscuras por las noches a iluminarse con candiles sin embargo quiere hacer este préstamo  para comprar un pequeño sistema solar  y así sus hijos  tengan una condición de vida mejor a la que ella tuvo
texts.en: Maria is a resident of the Flor de Pino community. She has lived there her whole life. She is 51 years old, married, and has 6 children. Most of them  are married and have their own families. The two boys who are the youngest go to the community school. She feels very happy to see them in school because she wants them to be educated. The way she earns her income is by growing basic grains. When she harvests them, she sells them and keeps some for household consumption. She also works on large farms in the community to receive more income, especially during the coffee harvest season. In the community there still isn't any electricity. She says that she is used to being in the dark at night and using candlelight, but she wants this loan to buy a small solar system so that her children can have a better quality of life than she had.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to have electricity in her home.

loans.name: Libia Ricela

texts.es:
Libia tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene tres  hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos  en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar. 

Se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz duro. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  Las  compras lo realizan  en Chimbo cada mes.  Su sueño es comprarse un terreno. Su desafío es el mal tiempo.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta  viajar con la familia.
texts.en:
Libia is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in the Chimbo canton in the Bolivar province. 

She works in agriculture. She plants hard corn. She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and materials. With the support of the loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizer. She makes her purchases in Chimbo every month. Her dream is to buy some land. Her challenge is bad weather. In her free time she likes to travel with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Renan

texts.en:
Renan is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy more recyclable materials needed in his junk shop. His income from business is assisting him with his daily expenses. He also sells different house appliances for additional income.  

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan to buy recyclable materials needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Renan hopes that his business will continue to expand. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and to draw strength from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. Elisa has been in the farming business for several years now. She helps her husband in tilling their farm.

Elisa needs a loan for her farm. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her yield and income.

In the future, Elisa hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Xanoglan

texts.en:
Xanoglan is 41 years old, married and has three children. All of his children go to school. His wife is a nurse in a local polyclinic. Xanoglan’s family is living in Boyuk Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region but for the past 21 years, they have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. 

Xanoglan is involved in the animal breeding business. At present he needs a loan of an amount of 1,800 (Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason Xanoglan has applied to Komak company. With this loan he wants to buy more cows to increase his business. He says a great thanks to the Kiva organization and the lenders for help. 

In the future Xanoglan wants to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Shierly

texts.en:
Shierly previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She also has a jeepney for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Shierly dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. As a CCT community partner, she attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angela Leonor

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 56 años de edad, está separada, pero de esa relación tuvo 6 hijos mayores de edad,  dos  de ellos aun vive con ella aunque ya están casados. 
Doña Ángela para salir adelante y poder ganar algo por su cuenta para su sustento y el de su familia realizo el primero de sus créditos y con esto surtió una  tienda de víveres  en su casa, empezó con poco y con la ayuda de los créditos que fue recibiendo la fue surtiendo mas y mas, vende víveres, legumbres, útiles escolares y artículos de bazar,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados. Tiene 9 años con su negocio con el cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar y otros víveres que no tiene para satisfacer a sus clientes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 10 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó  su negocio con el cual se gana la vida. Sus sueños  son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The 3 De Mayo credit group meets evert two weeks in the Jipijapa canton. It is known as the sultana of coffee because of the extensive coffee crops that have an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

This is where Ángela lives. She is 56 years old. She is separated and from that relationship has 6 grown children. Two of them still live with her, although they are married.  In order to get ahead and earn something to support herself and her family, Ángela took out the first loan. With it, she stocked a convenience store in her house. She started with little and with the help of the loans that she got she stocked more and more. She sells groceries, vegetables, school supplies, and miscellaneous items. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later. Her children help her when they can and they aren't busy. She has had this business for 9 years and with it she is getting ahead. 

She is going to use this loan to stock her store more. She is going to buy rice, sugar and other groceries that she doesn't have, in order to satisfy her customers. She has been in the credit group for 10 years and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she started her business with which she earns her living. Her dreams are to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Silvia De Jesús

texts.es:
Silvia de 43 años de edad. actualmente esta separada porque su esposo, la habandono.

Silvia actualmente ella trabaja una parcela de maiz, y lo aprendio de sus padres ya que ellos a eso se dedicaban, y ella como era la mayor de sus hermanos tenia que ayudar en la casa para hacer llegar el sustento diario, aparte de esto ella logro conprar  dos vacas  y en terminos de 1 año las esta vendiendo para obtener un dinero extra al final del año.

Ella se levanta a las 5A.M hacer los quehaceres de la casa, luego se traslada donde tiene la parcela de maiz y regresa, 1P.M  para seguir trabajando y a las 4P.M se traslada donde una hija que vive serca.  La hija vende tortillas, de esta manera colabora con su hija  ya que no le puede ayudar econmicamente. 

El préstamo será invertido en comprar 2 vacas,  y comprar algunos productos para la parcela que esta trabajando en este momento,  en este mes es donde ella empieza a trabajar proyentandose para el fin de año.

Silvia sueña con poder tener una mejor vivienda de la que ahora tiene, poder darle a su hijo el estudio que ella no pudo lograr. Asi el podra tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo, ella esta segura que con  esfuerzo podra hacer realidad sus sueños, y esta agradecida por la oportunidad que se le a brindado por medios de los creditos pues le ha servido como un impulso para trabajar.
texts.en:
Silvia is 43 years old and currently separated because her husband left her.  Silvia works a plot of corn and learned this from her parents because that is what they did.  Since she was the oldest child she had to help support the home.  She also bought two cows and started selling them after one year to earn year end money.

She rises at 5:00 am to do the household chores, she then goes to where she has her corn crop and returns at 1:00 pm to continue working and goes to where her daughter lives at 4:00 pm.  Her daughter sells tortillas and she helps her, since she is not able to help her financially.

She will use the money from this loan to buy two cows and some products for the land she is working at the moment.  This is the month when she begins to work and projects out to the end of the year.

Silvia wants to have a better house and provide her son with the education that she was not able to have.  In this way she can have better work opportunities.  She is certain that she will be able to make her dreams a reality and is grateful for the opportunities, such as a boost in work, that the loans provide her.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed spare parts and other supplies needed in her auto repair shop. Her loan also helped not just in her business but also in the educational expenses of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts, supplies and maintenance of her shop. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melissa hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, other items and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and her five children - four of them attend the public primary school - in Balata Camp in Nablus. Balata Camp is a Palestinian refugee camp established in the northern West Bank in 1950 adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank. Her husband is working in a public institution and is too familiar with having a low salary, especially when they are a big family and need to ensure their kids needs are met.

Hanadi is asking Ryada for this loan to repair the closet in the kitchen and for painting her house, which will enable them to live with more psychological comfort. This will help her to improve her house and make it better. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to repair the closet in the kitchen and to paint her house

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Simplicia hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her child will finish his studies.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia owns an eatery business within her locality. She usually offers viand such as tinola, adobo and menudo. Leticia is 53 years old. The gained income from her business goes toward the daily consumption and allowances of her family. Through her business, she is able to endure everything just to earn a living.

Leticia wants to develop her business and improve their living condition. With her determination to have a better way of life and become a successful entrepreneur someday, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000. She will use this amount to buy additional food products to offer such as raw meat, vegetables, pancit and kitchen utensils. She hopes these will boost her business for the betterment of their living condition as well as to save for future use.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, pancit and kitchen utensils for her restaurant business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 56-year-old man who is married and has six children age 28, 25, 23, 20, 18 and 17 years old whom he supports. 

He has a carpentry business, and he has been in this business for 20 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

This is his fifth loan of KES 80,000. He was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by the Visionfund officer. 

He’s planning to use the loan to purchase more stock for his business. He will use the profit to buy a power saw for his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to build rental houses and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her business. She was able to buy the needed farm inputs for her farm, which has been running for ten years now. Her income from business is assisting with her family's everyday household expenditures. As a widow, she works hard to provide for her family's needs. She also has a direct selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her farm. Her profits from this business will definitely help her meet their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her farm.
